text: today I'm making something really fun
it's a coconut key lime pie we've made
key lime tart before so today I thought
I'd do something just a little bit
different and I think you're gonna love
it I already have my crust baked it's an
easy pressing across the recipes on the
website stuart calm the filling take one
can of sweetened condensed milk your
classic accompaniment to the lime juice
in a key lime pie it's a 14 and a half
ounce can and then add a can of coconut
milk you're gonna get some great
tropical flavors here in the combination
of lime and coconut and then to that add
a third of a cup of key lime juice have
you seen key limes before these are key
limes are these tiny tiny super fragrant
little limes you can buy them and juice
them yourself and you can also buy key
lime juice in a bottle I don't usually
recommend using bottled anything but key
limes are really tiny it takes a lot to
make some juice
so I forgive you if you buy the bottled
whisk those ingredients together and
then you're gonna add your egg yolks
it's 7 large egg yolks and that's what's
going to set your pie in the oven you
could do your classic shell to shell egg
separating method I find that if your
eggs are room-temperature they fall
apart a little bit when you're
separating so separate cold eggs but if
you want to beat egg whites which I'm
not doing here you want room temperature
so you want to separate the mother cold
and then let them get to be room
temperature in order to get the most
volume from your beaten whites there you
know that's your lesson for the day
whisk have your oven preheating to 325
degrees and then pour your filling into
your already baked crust you can use
store-bought
I won't tell I guess or you should make
our very easy crust for the filling in
it'll come very high up into the pan
don't be alarmed I can't quite fit all
of it don't worry about it carefully
transport and then you want to
take this in your 325 degree oven until
it's just barely wobbly in the center
that should take about 40 minutes you
gotta let the pie cool and then
refrigerate it for at least an hour and
a half so that it's really nice and
chilled and then you can serve it top it
with whipped cream this is 2 cups of
cream a generous amount with about 2
tablespoons of confectioner sugar and
I'm getting my workout today by flipping
the creams I don't like it overly
whipped I like a nice loose peak now you
can top your pie with the cream spoon
your cream on top this is a crazy amount
of whipped cream but that's what makes
this super special you don't have to use
all of it I guess but listen why not
that's what I say it's a voluminous
billow of whipped cream on top just the
way I like it
finally some toasted coconut
this is sweetened coconut just toasted
